name: Amil
description: Support and development of corporate systems for customer service.
content: I started my contribution in this company as Support Analyst N2, after two years in this position i started to get interested in the systems development process. At this moment, the company used dotnet MVC stack for a fullstack development of the solutions. Self-taught, i began to understand the nuances and patterns that development teams used to deliver new features. I studied for a year CSharp, MVC, OOP and the tools that surrounded the development ecosystems, market ORMs like Entity Framework and NHibernate. Even as a Support Analyst I started to contribute to the development and bug fixing, submitting my code to the analysis of several more experienced developers, which made me advance many spots on the path to be a good dev.

name: SAT Rotas
description: Development of new product to leverage the customer's business.
content: In this project i've performed the role of fullstack developer, using dotnetcore version 2.3 on the backend and Angular version 10 on the frontend. The product to be developed for the customer started from scratch, using the CI & CD delivery standards, running a unit and integration test treadmill (using MsTest and xUnit) delivering the system in a webapplication on Azure, integrating with a SQL Server database. The product consists of solving problems of payment of transport vouchers and mobility of the workers of the company that would buy the solution. The big challenge of this project was integrate with the they routing tool (SATRotas - Roteirização) that they already developed. It was an enriching experience that made me evolve my skills even more.

name: Eleva Educação
description: Developing new features for a highly scalable critical product.
content: This project was for the development of a system that was already in production, it replaced a legacy system of enrollment of students from the client's school network. A massive system using the SAAS (Software As A Service) standard and using cloud hosting on AWS as well as the use of all tools (S3, EC2 etc). Very interesting the way the frontend was built, using ngRx or Redux for Angular for state management. On the backend we used dotnetcore ver 2.3. My contribution time on this project was 1 year, undoubtedly a great learning experience for me from the perspective of multitenancy applications and new development patterns.

name: Natura
description: Developing and supporting a highly complex systems using microservices standards.
content: In this project I worked as a backend developer, a giant project with several development fronts with several teams working together to develop and improve the client's products. The products mostly used the microservices pattern running on AWS using Lambda and message queues using SQS, interoperability between teams was crucial to make the whole solution make sense. It was a total immersion in the new standards of development, in a short time I was used to Typescript and now I use this language in most of my projects. I participated in this project for 4 months and contributed with the delivery of integration functionalities for the unification of information between LATAM and Mexico.
